  • Method Details

    • longestCommonPrefix

      public static String longestCommonPrefix​(String[] arr)
      Returns the longest string that is a prefix of all strings in the given array. For example, if the array is ["foo", "four", "football"], the method returns "fo". If the array is empty, returns an empty string.
      Parameters:
      arr - any array of strings.
      Returns:
      longest common prefix of the given strings

    • swapFirstLast

      public static void swapFirstLast​(int[] arr)
      Modifies the given array by exchanging the first half with the second half. If the array has odd length, the center element is not moved. For example, given array 
       [2, 4, 6, 99, 1, 2, 3]
      after swapFirstLast the array contains 
       [1, 2, 3, 99, 2, 4, 6]
      Note this method modifies the given array and returns void.
      Parameters:
      arr - the int array to be modified

    • swizzle

      public static void swizzle​(int[] arr, int[] swizzler)
      Rearrange the elements of arr according to the given list of indices. After calling this method, arr[i] should be the value formerly located at arr[swizzler[i]]. For example, if swizzler is [3, 0, 3, 1] and arr is 
       [10, 20, 30, 40]
      and then after this method executes, arr is 
       [40, 10, 40, 20].
      If the swizzler length does not match the array length, or if it contains any number that is out of range as an index in arr, the method does nothing. Note that this method modifies the given array and returns void.
      Parameters:
      arr - the int array to be modified
      swizzler - array of indices indicating new positions of elements

    • condense

      public static int[] condense​(int[] arr, int k)
      Creates a new array from the given one by adding up groups of k adjacent entries. The length of the returned array is always arr.length / k (integer division), and its ith element is the sum

      arr[ik] + arr[ik + 1] + arr[ik + 2] + ... + arr[ik + (k - 1)]

      If the array length is not an exact multiple of k, the excess elements are ignored. For example, if arr is [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7] and k is 3, the result is [6, 15].

      Parameters:
      arr - any int array
      k - number of adjacent elements in each group
      Returns:
      new array obtained by adding up groups of adjacent elements

    • isPermutation

      public static boolean isPermutation​(int[] arr)
      Determines whether arr is a permutation. We define a permutation as an array in which each number 0 through n - 1 appears exactly once, where n is the length of the array.
      Parameters:
      arr - an int array
      Returns:
      true if the given array is a permutation, false otherwise

    • findOneCycle

      public static int[] findOneCycle​(int[] arr, int start)
      Returns the cycle in arr beginning with the given starting index. A cycle in an array is a sequence of indices i0, i1, i2, ...ik for some k >= 0, such that:

      i1 = arr[i0], i2 = arr[i1], ..., and i0 = arr[ik].

      The sequence of indices is returned as an int array with the given start index at position 0. For example, given [2, 4, 0, 1, 3] and start = 3, the method returns [3, 1, 4]. (Note that if arr[start] == start, then the resulting cycle has length 1.) Returns null if the given array is not a permutation, or if the start index is out of bounds in arr.

      Parameters:
      arr - an int array
      start - starting point for finding a cycle
      Returns:
      array containing cycle indices, beginning with given start index

    • findAllCycles

      public static ArrayList<int[]> findAllCycles​(int[] arr)
      Returns a list of all cycles in the given array. For example, given [2, 1, 3, 0, 5, 4], the resulting list should contain [0, 2, 3], [1], and [4, 5]. The cycles in the resulting list should be disjoint; that is, for example, the list should not contain [2, 3, 0] in addition to [0, 2, 3], even though both arrays describe the same cycle. The order of cycles in the list is not specified. Returns an empty list if arr is not a permutation.
      Parameters:
      arr - an int array
      Returns:
      list of all cycles
